bigquery-warehouse.name: BigQuery Warehouse
bigquery-warehouse.description:
A block for querying a database with BigQuery.

Upon instantiating, a connection to BigQuery is established
and maintained for the life of the object until the close method is called.

It is recommended to use this block as a context manager, which will automatically
close the connection and its cursors when the context is exited.

It is also recommended that this block is loaded and consumed within a single task
or flow because if the block is passed across separate tasks and flows,
the state of the block's connection and cursor could be lost.
bigquery-warehouse.code_example:
```python
from prefect_gcp.bigquery import BigQueryWarehouse

bigquery_warehouse_block = BigQueryWarehouse.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: BigQueryWarehouse
fields.description:
A block for querying a database with BigQuery.

Upon instantiating, a connection to BigQuery is established
and maintained for the life of the object until the close method is called.

It is recommended to use this block as a context manager, which will automatically
close the connection and its cursors when the context is exited.

It is also recommended that this block is loaded and consumed within a single task
or flow because if the block is passed across separate tasks and flows,
the state of the block's connection and cursor could be lost.

fetch_size.title: Fetch Size
fetch_size.description: The number of rows to fetch at a time.

GcpCredentials.title: GcpCredentials
GcpCredentials.description:
Block used to manage authentication with GCP. Google authentication is
handled via the `google.oauth2` module or through the CLI.
Specify either one of service `account_file` or `service_account_info`; if both
are not specified, the client will try to detect the credentials following Google's
[Application Default Credentials](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/application-default-credentials).
See Google's [Authentication documentation](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication#service-accounts)
for details on inference and recommended authentication patterns.

service_account_file.title: Service Account File
service_account_file.description: Path to the service account JSON keyfile.

service_account_info.title: Service Account Info
service_account_info.description: The contents of the keyfile as a dict.

project.title: Project
project.description: The GCP project to use for the client.

cloud-run-job.name: GCP Cloud Run Job
cloud-run-job.description: Infrastructure block used to run GCP Cloud Run Jobs. Note this block is experimental. The interface may change without notice.
cloud-run-job.code_example:
```python
from prefect_gcp.cloud_run import CloudRunJob

cloud_run_job_block = CloudRunJob.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: CloudRunJob
fields.description: Infrastructure block used to run GCP Cloud Run Jobs. Note this block is experimental. The interface may change without notice.

type.title: Type
type.description: The slug for this task type.

env.title: Env
env.description: Environment variables to be passed to your Cloud Run Job.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Labels applied to the infrastructure for metadata purposes.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name applied to the infrastructure for identification.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to run in the infrastructure.

image.title: Image Name
image.description: The image to use for a new Cloud Run Job. This value must refer to an image within either Google Container Registry or Google Artifact Registry, like `gcr.io/<project_name>/<repo>/`.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region where the Cloud Run Job resides.

cpu.title: CPU
cpu.description: The amount of compute allocated to the Cloud Run Job. The int must be valid based on the rules specified at https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/cpu#setting-jobs .

memory.title: Memory
memory.description: The amount of memory allocated to the Cloud Run Job.

memory_unit.title: Memory Units
memory_unit.description: The unit of memory. See https://cloud.google.com/run/docs/configuring/memory-limits#setting for additional details.

vpc_connector_name.title: VPC Connector Name
vpc_connector_name.description: The name of the VPC connector to use for the Cloud Run Job.

args.title: Args
args.description: Arguments to be passed to your Cloud Run Job's entrypoint command.

keep_job.title: Keep Job After Completion
keep_job.description: Keep the completed Cloud Run Job on Google Cloud Platform.

timeout.title: Job Timeout
timeout.description: The length of time that Prefect will wait for a Cloud Run Job to complete before raising an exception.

gcp-credentials.name: GCP Credentials
gcp-credentials.description:
Block used to manage authentication with GCP. Google authentication is
handled via the `google.oauth2` module or through the CLI.
Specify either one of service `account_file` or `service_account_info`; if both

gcp-credentials.code_example:
Load GCP credentials stored in a `GCP Credentials` Block:
```python
from prefect_gcp import GcpCredentials
gcp_credentials_block = GcpCredentials.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

vertex-ai-custom-training-job.name: Vertex AI Custom Training Job
vertex-ai-custom-training-job.description: Infrastructure block used to run Vertex AI custom training jobs.

fields.title: VertexAICustomTrainingJob
fields.description: Infrastructure block used to run Vertex AI custom training jobs.

type.title: Type
type.description: The slug for this task type.

env.title: Environment Variables
env.description: Environment variables to be passed to your Cloud Run Job.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Labels applied to the infrastructure for metadata purposes.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name applied to the infrastructure for identification.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to run in the infrastructure.

gcp_credentials.title: Gcp Credentials
gcp_credentials.description: GCP credentials to use when running the configured Vertex AI custom training job. If not provided, credentials will be inferred from the environment. See `GcpCredentials` for details.

region.title: Region
region.description: The region where the Vertex AI custom training job resides.

image.title: Image Name
image.description: The image to use for a new Vertex AI custom training job. This value must refer to an image within either Google Container Registry or Google Artifact Registry, like `gcr.io/<project_name>/<repo>/`.

machine_type.title: Machine Type
machine_type.description: The machine type to use for the run, which controls the available CPU and memory.

accelerator_type.title: Accelerator Type
accelerator_type.description: The type of accelerator to attach to the machine.

network.title: Network
network.description: The full name of the Compute Engine networkto which the Job should be peered. Private services access must already be configured for the network. If left unspecified, the job is not peered with any network.

reserved_ip_ranges.title: Reserved Ip Ranges
reserved_ip_ranges.description: A list of names for the reserved ip ranges under the VPC network that can be used for this job. If set, we will deploy the job within the provided ip ranges. Otherwise, the job will be deployed to any ip ranges under the provided VPC network.

service_account.title: Service Account
service_account.description: Specifies the service account to use as the run-as account in Vertex AI. The agent submitting jobs must have act-as permission on this run-as account. If unspecified, the AI Platform Custom Code Service Agent for the CustomJob's project is used. Takes precedence over the service account found in gcp_credentials, and required if a service account cannot be detected in gcp_credentials.

job_watch_poll_interval.title: Job Watch Poll Interval
job_watch_poll_interval.description: The amount of time to wait between GCP API calls while monitoring the state of a Vertex AI Job.
